feed.title: Lareau Lab
feed.subtitle: The Lareau Laboratory for Computational and Translation Immunology is housed in the csBio Program at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, New York, NY.

entry.title: Single Cell Genomics Day 2024
entry.content: The lab debuts its work on PERFF-seq at Single Cell Genomics Day 2024 via a YouTube livestream. Thank you to Rahul for the invitation to present!

entry.title: 2nd Annual Probing Human Disease
entry.content: The lab presents its work in beautiful Cancun, Mexico at the 2nd Annual Probing Human Disease with Single Cell Technologies Conference. Thank you to the organizers for inviting us back to present!

entry.title: New rotation students!
entry.content: The lab welcomes Sherry Nyeo, Jonathan Levine, and Hoyin Chu as its first rotation students from the Cornell Tri-I CBM program!
entry.summary: The lab welcomes Sherry Nyeo, Jonathan Levine, and Hoyin Chu as its first rotation students from the Cornell Tri-I CBM program!

entry.title: Welcome Josch and Laura!
entry.content: Laura Kida and Josch Hsieh join the group! Laura is studying for her MD in Berlin, and Josch is currently a PhD candidate in Leif Ludwig’s group. Both will be in the lab for several months to help establish new directions as they study for their theses. Welcome!

entry.title: New paper on HHV-6 reactivation out today!

entry.title: Arthur Chow, our first postdoc, joins!

link.title: Arthur Chow, our first postdoc, joins!

entry.content: Arthur Chow, PhD, joins the group as the lab’s first postdoctoral fellow! Arthur completed his PhD at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. He brings a wealth of experimental expertise and technical support from Kinzo, Ono, and Zuka. Welcome Arthur!

entry.title: Sparkathon Emerging Leader, 2023
entry.content: Caleb participates in the SITC Sparkathon 2023 emerging leaders symposium in Chicago, IL. While at the conference, he received a Distinguished Young Investigator award from the organizers of the class. We’re excited to participate in the main conference in San Diego this November!

entry.title: Lab++
entry.content: Benan Nalbant (Senior Research Technician) joins the lab as the first member! Benan joins the lab after spending years at CSHL developing cell models to study transcription factor dependencies in cancer. Welcome Benan!
